description: Internet of Things, embedded systems, and device management

questions.question: What are the device hardware constraints (memory, CPU, battery)?
questions.why: Determines protocol choice, payload size, and processing location (edge vs cloud)

questions.question: What communication protocol will devices use?
questions.why: MQTT, CoAP, HTTP, LoRaWAN have different tradeoffs for latency, power, and reliability

questions.question: What OTA firmware update requirements exist?
questions.why: Secure updates require signed firmware, staged rollouts, and rollback capability

questions.question: What offline operation requirements exist?
questions.why: Devices may need local storage, edge processing, and sync when connectivity restored

questions.question: What device provisioning and authentication method will be used?
questions.why: X.509 certificates, tokens, or TPM-based auth have different security and operational tradeoffs

questions.question: How many devices are expected at scale?
questions.why: 10K vs 1M devices require different infrastructure for connection handling and data ingestion

questions.question: What telemetry data frequency and retention is required?
questions.why: High-frequency data (1Hz+) requires time-series databases and data downsampling strategies

questions.question: What device management capabilities are needed?
questions.why: Remote configuration, diagnostics, and lifecycle management affect platform architecture

questions.question: Is edge computing/gateway processing required?
questions.why: Edge processing reduces cloud costs and latency but adds deployment complexity

questions.question: Are there industry-specific certifications required (UL, CE, FCC)?
questions.why: Hardware certifications may affect software architecture and update processes
